In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        current_line *= " " * word
    end
    push!(lines, current_line) # Push the last line
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nulla tristique."
print(wrap_string(s))
```
